text: The Manila North Cemetery (in Spanish: Cemeterio del Norte) is one of the oldest cemeteries in Metro Manila, Philippines. It is also one of the largest cemeteries in Manila. It stands right next to the La Loma Cemetery and the Manila Chinese Cemetery. As of 2017, over one million people have been buried in Manila North Cemetery. == Community == Due to the fact that Manila is a very populated city, some people live inside the cemetery. Approximately 6000 people live in the cemetery. == Famous people buried == A lot of famous people, including government officials, were buried in the Manila North Cemetery. ==References== Category:Metro Manila Category:Cemeteries
title: Manila North Cemetery
